page.title: 04Farming in Abbotsley
page.content: The house we live in is 400 to 500 years old.Life on a farm starts about seven o'clock in the morning,we don't have any breakfast as soon as we get up because the cows,cattle and calves need feeding and milking,my mum does that by hand.We keep half the milk for cooking and making butter.We feed the cows and cattle on rolled oats and barley,my dad also puts in nuts.My dad and Uncle John muck out the yard once a year.The muck is put on the land to help the crops grow.Farmers work seven days a week and about twelve hours a day.The only animals my dad has on the farm are horses and Fresian and Hereford cattle.We buy most of our calves from Derbyshire.They are usually only one week old and they are fed either on a bucket,bottle or put on one of the cows. (Continued on page 5)
